verses.text: Better \add is\add* the poor that walketh in his integrity, Than \add he that is\add* perverse in his lips, and \add is\add* a fool.
Also, \add that\add* the soul \add be\add* without knowledge, \add it is\add* not good; And he that hasteth with \add his\add* feet, sinneth.
The foolishness of man perverteth his way: And his heart fretteth against the \sc Lord\sc*.
Wealth maketh many friends; But the poor is separated from his neighbour.
A false witness shall not be unpunished, And \add he that\add* speaketh lies shall not escape.
Many will intreat the favour of the prince: And every \add man is\add* a friend to him that giveth gifts.
All the brethren of the poor do hate him: How much more do his friends go far from him! He pursueth \add them with\add* words, \add yet\add* they \add are\add* wanting \add to him\add*.
He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul: He that keepeth understanding shall find good.
A false witness shall not be unpunished, And \add he that\add* speaketh lies shall perish.
Delight \add is\add* not seemly for a fool; Much less for a servant to have rule over princes.
The discretion of a man deferreth his anger; And \add it is\add* his glory to pass over a transgression.
The king’s wrath \add is\add* as the roaring of a lion; But his favour \add is\add* as dew upon the grass.
A foolish son \add is\add* the calamity of his father: And the contentions of a wife \add are\add* a continual dropping.
House and riches \add are\add* the inheritance of fathers: And a prudent wife \add is\add* from the \sc Lord\sc*.
Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; And an idle soul shall suffer hunger.
He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his own soul; \add But\add* he that despiseth his ways shall die.
He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the \sc Lord\sc*; And that which he hath given will he pay him again.
Chasten thy son while there is hope, And let not thy soul spare for his crying.
\add A man\add* of great wrath \add shall\add* suffer punishment: For if thou deliver \add him\add*, yet thou must do \add it\add* again.
Hear counsel, and receive instruction, That thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.
\add There are\add* many devices in a man’s heart; Nevertheless the counsel of the \sc Lord\sc*, that shall stand.
The desire of a man \add is\add* his kindness: And a poor \add man is\add* better than a liar.
The fear of the \sc Lord\sc* \add tendeth\add* to life: And \add he that hath it\add* shall abide satisfied; He shall not be visited \add with\add* evil.
A slothful \add man\add* hideth his hand in \add his\add* bosom, And will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
Smite a scorner, and the simple will beware: And reprove one that hath understanding, \add and\add* he will understand knowledge.
He that wasteth \add his\add* father, \add and\add* chaseth away \add his\add* mother, \add Is\add* a son that causeth shame, and bringeth reproach.
Cease, my son, to hear the instruction \add That causeth\add* to err from the words of knowledge.
An ungodly witness scorneth judgment: And the mouth of the wicked devoureth iniquity.
Judgments are prepared for scorners, And stripes for the back of fools.
